title: Developer guide: Writing a data wrapper class
text: can begin create output files web server route details cells data type. Files cells data type can contain cell-level observations, dimensionality reduction coordinates cell. now, can create new function called create_cells_list fill later. make_cells_file_def_creator function creates returns new "file definition creator" function. file definition creator functions must take base_url parameter return complete file definition. File definitions lists named values: type: Vitessce data type string (convenience, values DataType list can used), fileType: Vitessce file type string (convenience, values FileType list can used), url: URL string (required file types, optional raster.json file type), options: optional list extra options (necessary JSON file types). convert_and_save append new file definition creator list self$file_def_creators append new web server route self$routes. Next, want fill create_cells_list function. function return R list automatically converted JSON object jsonlite. reference: cells.json schema cells.json small example cells.json full example know need obtain following Seurat object: unique ID cell, (x, y) scatterplot coordinate representing first two dimensions dimensionality reduction cell. inspect Seurat object R environment, can see type S4 object class Seurat. access values S4 object, can use slot(obj, "key") "key" replaced key part object want access. Inspecting object , can see : dimensionality reductions stored key "reductions" cell barcodes stored key "active.ident" generalize function, can get list names dimensionality reduction available names(slot(obj, "reductions")). can get list cell IDs names(slot(obj, "active.ident")). can iterate cell IDs set new empty object obj_list(). Note obj_list() returns empty R list always translated JSON object (rather base R list() translated JSON array empty). can iterate available dimensionality reduction cell. obtain cell's (x,y) coordinates embedding_matrix[cell_id, 1:2] embedding_matrix dimensionality reduction matrix. example, dimensionality reduction "pca" matrix can accessed slot(slot(obj, "reductions")[["pca"]], "cell.embeddings"). Finally, return R list created.
code: SeuratWrapper <- R6::R6Class("SeuratWrapper",   inherit = AbstractWrapper,   public = list(     obj = NULL,     initialize = function(obj, ...) {       super$initialize(...)       self$obj <- obj     },     create_cells_list = function() {         # TODO     },     make_cells_file_def_creator = function(dataset_uid, obj_i) {       get_cells <- function(base_url) {         file_def <- list(           type = DataType$CELLS,           fileType = FileType$CELLS_JSON,           url = super$get_url(base_url, dataset_uid, obj_i, "cells.json")         )         return(file_def)       }       return(get_cells)     },     convert_and_save = function(dataset_uid, obj_i) {       super$convert_and_save(dataset_uid, obj_i)              # Get list representations of the data.       cells_list <- self$create_cells_list()        # Convert the lists to JSON strings.       cells_json <- jsonlite::toJSON(cells_list)        # Save the JSON strings to JSON files.       write(cells_json, file = self$get_out_dir(dataset_uid, obj_i, "cells.json"))        # Get the file definition creator functions.       cells_file_creator <- self$make_cells_file_def_creator(dataset_uid, obj_i)        # Append the new file definition creator function to the main list.       self$file_def_creators <- append(self$file_def_creators, cells_file_creator)        # Append a new web server route object which corresponds to the directory of JSON files to be served.       self$routes <- append(self$routes, self$get_out_dir_route(dataset_uid, obj_i))     }   ) ) SeuratWrapper <- R6::R6Class("SeuratWrapper",   inherit = AbstractWrapper,   public = list(     obj = NULL,     initialize = function(obj, ...) {       super$initialize(...)       self$obj <- obj     },     create_cells_list = function() {         obj <- self$obj         embeddings <- slot(obj, "reductions")         available_embeddings <- names(embeddings)          cell_ids <- names(slot(obj, "active.ident"))         cells_list <- obj_list()         for(cell_id in cell_ids) {             cells_list[[cell_id]] <- list(                 mappings = obj_list()             )         }         for(embedding_name in available_embeddings) {             embedding <- embeddings[[embedding_name]]             embedding_matrix <- slot(embedding, "cell.embeddings")             for(cell_id in cell_ids) {                 cells_list[[cell_id]]$mappings[[embedding_name]] <- unname(embedding_matrix[cell_id, 1:2])             }         }          return(cells_list)     },     make_cells_file_def_creator = function(dataset_uid, obj_i) {       get_cells <- function(base_url) {         file_def <- list(           type = DataType$CELLS,           fileType = FileType$CELLS_JSON,           url = super$get_url(base_url, dataset_uid, obj_i, "cells.json")         )         return(file_def)       }       return(get_cells)     },     convert_and_save = function(dataset_uid, obj_i) {       super$convert_and_save(dataset_uid, obj_i)              # Get list representations of the data.       cells_list <- self$create_cells_list()        # Convert the lists to JSON strings.       cells_json <- jsonlite::toJSON(cells_list)        # Save the JSON strings to JSON files.       write(cells_json, file = self$get_out_dir(dataset_uid, obj_i, "cells.json"))        # Get the file definition creator functions.       cells_file_creator <- self$make_cells_file_def_creator(dataset_uid, obj_i)        # Append the new file definition creator function to the main list.       self$file_def_creators <- append(self$file_def_creators, cells_file_creator)        # Append a new web server route object which corresponds to the directory of JSON files to be served.       self$routes <- append(self$routes, self$get_out_dir_route(dataset_uid, obj_i))     }   ) )

Confirm CLI installed: Configure AWS CLI using configuration methods, environment variable method. case AWS S3, know ahead time data files ultimately served S3 bucket, can include base_url with_config = TRUE parameters calling export function. instance, intend upload files AWS S3 bucket called my_bucket: directory ./my_vitessce_files now contain three data files, plus view config JSON file (config.json): cells.json cell-sets.json clusters.json config.json (file URLs config include base_url bucket)

title: Usage with JSON: Local Example
text: serve downloaded JSON files, move new folder (instance vitessce_json_example Downloads folder). Using terminal, change directories folder containing JSON files. Serve contents directory (JSON files) using http-server:

title: Usage with JSON: Local Example
text: Add JSON files dataset using add_file function. add_file function returns updated dataset, allowing function calls chained.
code: library(vitessceR)  base_url <- "http://localhost:8000/"  # Create Vitessce view config vc <- VitessceConfig$new("Codeluppi et al., Nature Methods 2018") dataset <- vc$add_dataset("Codeluppi")$add_file(   url = paste0(base_url, "linnarsson.cells.json"),   data_type = DataType$CELLS,   file_type = FileType$CELLS_JSON )$add_file(   url = paste0(base_url, "linnarsson.cell-sets.json"),   data_type = DataType$CELL_SETS,   file_type = FileType$CELL_SETS_JSON )$add_file(   url = paste0(base_url, "linnarsson.molecules.json"),   data_type = DataType$MOLECULES,   file_type = FileType$MOLECULES_JSON )$add_file(   url = paste0(base_url, "linnarsson.clusters.json"),   data_type = DataType$EXPRESSION_MATRIX,   file_type = FileType$CLUSTERS_JSON )$add_file(   url = paste0(base_url, "linnarsson.raster.json"),   data_type = DataType$RASTER,   file_type = FileType$RASTER_JSON )  desc <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$DESCRIPTION) desc <- desc$set_props(description = "Codeluppi et al., Nature Methods 2018: Spatial organization of the somatosensory cortex revealed by osmFISH.")  spatial <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$SPATIAL) spatial_layers <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$LAYER_CONTROLLER)  scatterplot_pca <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$SCATTERPLOT, mapping = "PCA") scatterplot_tsne <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$SCATTERPLOT, mapping = "t-SNE") status <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$STATUS)  cell_sets <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$CELL_SETS) gene_list <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$GENES) heatmap <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$HEATMAP)$set_props(transpose = TRUE)  vc$layout(hconcat(   vconcat(vconcat(desc, status), spatial_layers),   vconcat(heatmap, spatial),   vconcat(scatterplot_tsne, scatterplot_pca),   vconcat(gene_list, cell_sets) ))  # Render the Vitessce widget vc$widget(theme = "light")

title: Usage with Shiny
text: running Shiny app remote server, need use base_url parameter vc$widget() function. value base_url provided, default http://localhost base URL overridden, allowing client Shiny app running different computer Shiny server. also may want serve Vitessce widget data files custom static web server rather built-R plumber web server (either security scalability reasons). , sure set parameter out_dir calling SeuratWrapper$new() constructor. allow specify output directory converted Vitessce data files. , can set parameter serve FALSE vc$widget() prevent built-plumber server starting launch widget. example, know Shiny server running http://example.com/shiny want turn plumber server, call vc$widget(base_url = "http://example.com/shiny", serve = FALSE). following example demonstrates swapping Vitessce widget's built-server Shiny's addResourcePath:
code: library(shiny) library(vitessceR) library(SeuratData)  SeuratData::InstallData("pbmc3k") data("pbmc3k.final") force(pbmc3k.final)  OUT_DIR <- "./my_vitessce_files"  ui <- fluidPage(   "Vitessce in a Shiny app",   vitessce_output(output_id = 'vitessce_visualization', height = "600px"), )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   addResourcePath("vitessce", OUT_DIR)   output$vitessce_visualization <- render_vitessce(expr = {     vc <- VitessceConfig$new("My config")     dataset <- vc$add_dataset("My dataset")     dataset <- dataset$add_object(SeuratWrapper$new(pbmc3k.final, out_dir = OUT_DIR))     scatterplot <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$SCATTERPLOT, mapping = "pca")     vc$layout(scatterplot)          BASE_URL <- paste0(       session$clientData$url_protocol,       "//",       session$clientData$url_hostname,       ":",       session$clientData$url_port,       "/vitessce"     )      vc$widget(serve = FALSE, base_url = BASE_URL)   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Usage with Shiny
text: default, Shiny includes CSS bootstrap apps. bootstrap styles (font sizes particular) can interfere styles Vitessce widget. One solution add CSS reset font sizes root element Shiny app:
code: library(shiny) library(vitessceR) library(SeuratData)  SeuratData::InstallData("pbmc3k") data("pbmc3k.final") force(pbmc3k.final)  ui <- fluidPage(   tags$head(     tags$style(HTML("       html, body {         font-size: inherit;       }     "))   ),   "Vitessce in a Shiny app",   vitessce_output(output_id = 'vitessce_visualization', height = "600px"), )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$vitessce_visualization <- render_vitessce(expr = {     vc <- VitessceConfig$new("My config")     dataset <- vc$add_dataset("My dataset")     dataset <- dataset$add_object(SeuratWrapper$new(pbmc3k.final))     scatterplot <- vc$add_view(dataset, Component$SCATTERPLOT, mapping = "pca")     vc$layout(scatterplot)     vc$widget()   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

what: Enumeration of Coordination Type values — CoordinationType
title: Enumeration of Coordination Type values — CoordinationType
text: CoordinationType list contains enumeration valid string constant values representing coordination types coordination space. DATASET: dataset used view. EMBEDDING_TYPE: type embedding used embedding scatterplot view, example "UMAP" "t-SNE". EMBEDDING_ZOOM: zoom level embedding scatterplot view. EMBEDDING_ROTATION: rotation embedding scatterplot view. EMBEDDING_TARGET_X: x-axis center embedding scatterplot view. EMBEDDING_TARGET_Y: y-axis center embedding scatterplot view. EMBEDDING_TARGET_Z: z-axis center embedding scatterplot view. SPATIAL_ZOOM: zoom level spatial view. SPATIAL_ROTATION: rotation spatial view. SPATIAL_TARGET_X: x-coordinate center spatial view. SPATIAL_TARGET_Y: y-coordinate center spatial view. SPATIAL_TARGET_Z: z-coordinate center spatial view. HEATMAP_ZOOM_X: x-axis zoom level heatmap view. HEATMAP_ZOOM_Y: y-axis zoom level heatmap view. HEATMAP_TARGET_X: x-coordinate center heatmap view. HEATMAP_TARGET_Y: y-coordinate center heatmap view. CELL_FILTER: subset cells include filtering. CELL_HIGHLIGHT: subset cells highlight. CELL_SET_SELECTION: subset cell sets select. CELL_SET_HIGHLIGHT: subset cell sets highlight. CELL_SET_COLOR: mapping cell sets colors. GENE_FILTER: subset genes include filtering. GENE_HIGHLIGHT: subset genes highlight. GENE_SELECTION: subset genes select. GENE_EXPRESSION_COLORMAP: colormap use gene expression scale. GENE_EXPRESSION_COLORMAP_RANGE: range gene expression values map. CELL_COLOR_ENCODING: color encoding use cell entities. SPATIAL_LAYERS: Layer definitions spatial view. GENOMIC_ZOOM: zoom level higlass view. GENOMIC_TARGET_X: x-coordinate center higlass view. GENOMIC_TARGET_Y: y-coordinate center higlass view. ADDITIONAL_CELL_SETS: User-defined cell sets.

title: Vitessce Widget — vitessce_widget
text: config view config VitessceConfig object. theme theme widget, either "dark" "light". Optional. default, "dark". width width widget number CSS string. Optional. height height widget number CSS string. Optional. port port local web server (serves local dataset objects widget). Optional. default, uses open port 8000 9000. base_url base URL web server. Optional. default, creates localhost URL includes port. serve local data served running local web server R plumber? default, TRUE. element_id element ID. Optional.
